title: Hecarim Assassin is now viable.
body: Due to the changes with stormraider's surge, my main Hecarim is now actually a really solid assassin. If you build Yommu's, Warrior, Death's Dance, and Swiftie's, Hecarim can completely destroy squishies, while still holding his own in a teamfight. Basically, if Hecarim pops his Yommu's for the extra passive AD and movespeed, and manages to deal 30% of an enemies health in the large window of 2.5 seconds, he gets a huge chunk of AD from the 40% MS buff, as well as getting 100% slow from the Swifties + Stormraider's. Combine that with a distortion ghost, and Hecarim can completely destroy just about anything completely out of nowhere. He even has a great escape/engage/cc with his ult. The problem is, everyone thinks that Hecarim Assassin is stupid. Can someone explain why Hecarim Assassin wouldn't work?

Tried this for the first time today.

Oh my god it works so well. I forgot to put ghost on, and I was still annihilating squishies.

The only downfall I can see is that Hecarim transitions from being an initiator to being a follow up. So just be careful about when you pick off a squishy. He has always been a backline threat even with the tankier build, but you trade off tank stats for deleting squishy.
I forgot my ghost the first time too, and I got a quad. It's really fun too. I also built Cleaver so he got slightly less squishy

Why would you build full assassin when you can actually still do the job of an assassin because you have huge damage already with 2 offensive items and the rest full tank? is kind of the reasoning imo.

Hecarim does have really high damage early game with those two offensive items, but he falls off late game even with natural scaling armor and health. With assassin, he can do a LOT more damage per attack, that could even carry into late game
